town_generator package¶

Submodules¶

town_generator.area module¶

This module implements the Area object.

class town_generator.area.Area(polygon, category, sub_areas=None)¶

Bases: object

Implements areas. These are contained by cities.

property category¶
components()¶
static get_id()¶
property identity¶

Returns id

members = []¶
property polygon¶
split(percentage, direction, inplace=True, new_category=<Category.GARDEN: 8>)¶

Split an area in two areas. Store result in self.sub_areas if inplace == True.

Parameters

  • percentage – float - percentage of surface for first area, between 0

  • 1 direction (and) – int - side for first area (from center to

  • = North (0) – Category - category of the

  • = East...) new_category (90) – Category - category of the

  • area (second) –

Returns: if inplace == False

area1: Area area2: Area

Tests:
>>> surf = Area(Polygon([(0,0), (20,0), (20,40), (0,40)]),
>>>     Category.HOUSE)
>>> res = surf.split(0.25, 0, False)  # house takes 1/4 of surface
                                        and is north
>>> res0 = Polygon([(0, 30), (0, 40), (20, 40), (20, 30), (0, 30)])
>>> res0.symmetric_difference(res[0].polygon).area < 1
True

town_generator.city module¶

This module implements a city object, heart of the generation.

class town_generator.city.City(population, density=10000, has_walls=False, has_castle=False, has_river=False)¶

Bases: object

Implements the city object. It’s the top of the hierarchy. It contains areas.

town_generator.doors module¶

This module enables to create doors.

town_generator.doors.create_doors(walls, roads, land)¶

Computes doors at the intersection of walls and roads.

Parameters

  • walls (Polygon) – polygon representing the outer walls of the city.

  • roads (Polygon) – polygon representing the roads of the city.

Returns

list of polygons

Return type

[Polygon]

town_generator.houses module¶

This module functions to create houses.

town_generator.houses.create_houses(land, population)¶

Compute a varying number of houses. Houses’ number and size depends on the city population. Houses are created from the center of the city and not too close to the walls.

Parameters

  • land (Polygon) – walls of the city.

  • population (int) – population of the city.

Returns

polygons representing houses.

Return type

[Polygon]

town_generator.houses.cut_houses(houses, roads)¶

Cut previously generated houses (polygons) to avoid overlapping roads.

Parameters

  • houses ([Polygon]) – list of polygons representing houses.

  • roads (Polygon) – polygon representing roads.

Returns

list of new polygons representing houses.

Return type

[Polygon]

town_generator.houses.reduce_houses(houses)¶

Scales down the houses.

Parameters

houses ([Polygon]) – list of polygons representing houses.

Returns

list of polygon representing houses.

Return type

[Polygon]

town_generator.regions module¶

This module implements Voronoi’s pavage to split the map into regions.

town_generator.regions.create_regions(population, density)¶

Compute a varying number of regions. Regions’ size depends on population and density.

Parameters

  • population (int) – population of the city.

  • density (int) – density of the city.

Returns

polygons representing regions.

Return type

[Polygon]

town_generator.roads module¶

This module enables to create roads.

town_generator.roads.create_roads(regions)¶

Computes main roads delimiting regions.

Parameters

regions ([Polygon]) – regions of the city.

Returns

computed roads.

Return type

Polygon

town_generator.roads.cut_roads(roads, land)¶

Resize the roads to stay inside the land.

Parameters

  • roads (Polygon) – polygon representing the roads.

  • land (Polygon) – polygon representing the land.

Returns

polygon representing the roads.

Return type

Polygon

town_generator.tools module¶

This module enables to save a city into a JSON file.

town_generator.tools.json(city, filename)¶

Saves a city object into a JSON file.

Parameters

  • city (City) – city object.

  • filename (string) – location to save JSON file.

town_generator.towers module¶

This module enables to create towers.

town_generator.towers.create_towers(walls)¶

Computes towers on outer walls angles.

Parameters

walls (Polygon) – polygon representing the outer walls of the city.

Returns

list of polygons representing towers.

Return type

[Polygon]

town_generator.viewer module¶

This module displays a city JSON file.

town_generator.viewer.display(filename)¶

Displays a city object.

Parameters

filename (string) – location of a JSON file representing a city.

town_generator.walls module¶

This module enables to create walls.

town_generator.walls.create_walls(land)¶

Compute walls from the perimeter of the roads.

Parameters

land (Polygon) – main roads of the city.

Returns

walls of the city.

Return type

Polygon
